column4: Hi - I've install boot-up-manager, but where do I find it to run it?
maybe 'system -> admin' ?
: Thanks :) (n00b)
'dpkg -L proftpd' to try to find it
maybe you're expected to create it
stand by
hm. according to this: http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_contents.pl?word=proftpd.conf&searchmode=searchfiles&case=insensitive&version=breezy&arch=i386
/etc/proftpd.conf is *not* put in /etc
unless maybe it's done by a debconf script
ah-ha. have you tried 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure proftpd' ?
nope?
see if that gives you any configuration options
alternatively, just create the file yourself
:0 -proftpd is not installed!!
ah-ha
so install it ;)
I always get E: could not find package xxxx or somesuch
put your /etc/apt/sources.list up on the pastebin
to install proftpd for a lampp install, do i want a standalone install or inetd install?
standalone is probably simpler, but i don't know what's best
thanks, I'll do that. I already have the xampp install, just minus fpt (i had a fpt daemon running during the xampp install)
